name: Alif
description: Alif (ا) is the 1st letter of the Arabic alphabet. It is written as a simple vertical stroke with no dots or curves, giving it a clean and elegant appearance.
makhraj_description: The letter Alif is produced from the deepest part of the throat. It flows out naturally without using the tongue or lips and often appears as a long vowel sound when elongated.

makhraj_description: The letter Bāʼ is pronounced by pressing both lips together completely and then releasing them with a clear voiced sound. It is crisp and doesn’t involve nasal airflow.
